ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: nor will they be allowed to offer any excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Nor given leave to make excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor will they be allowed to proffer excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: nor will they be permitted to offer any excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Nor will they be given permission to present excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they will not be permitted to put forth any excuse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And permission shall not be given to them so that they should offer excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: neither be given leave, and excuse themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nor are they suffered to put forth excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: nor shall they be permitted to offer excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor shall they be permitted so that they might excuse themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: nor will they be permitted to offer excuses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor will it be open to them to put forth pleas.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they will not be permitted to put forth any excuse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor shall they be given permission, so that they can apologize.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they will not be allowed to apologize.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:36] nor will they be given permission, to offer excuses, and so offer excuses (fa-ya‘tadhirūna is a supplement to yu’dhanu, ‘given permission’, but without being a direct result of it, since it belongs within the confines of the [general] denial [of permission], in other words, ‘there will be no permission, hence no excuses’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 720 (Nor are they suffered) nor are they given permission (to put forth excuses.
